weather.info: Natural light exposure regulates your circadian rhythm, improving sleep quality and daytime energy.
weather.rec_early_sunrise: Early sunrise. Take advantage of natural light to wake up naturally and regulate your circadian rhythm.
weather.rec_late_sunrise: Late sunrise. Consider using a natural light lamp when waking up to activate your body.
weather.rec_sunset: Sunset is at {time}. Reduce bright lights 2-3 hours before bed to prepare your body.
weather.rec_short_day: Short day (winter). Increase your natural light exposure during the day to maintain energy.
weather.rec_long_day: Long day (summer). Use blackout curtains for better sleep. Early light may wake your body prematurely.

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.good: Excellent! You're sleeping well (7-9 hours). Keep this routine.
recommendations.low: You're sleeping too little (less than 7 hours). Try going to bed earlier.
recommendations.high: You're sleeping too much (more than 9 hours). It may be a sign of accumulated fatigue.
tips: Keep your room cool and dark
Exercise regularly, but not before bedtime
